content:
BEGININPUT
BEGINCONTEXT
url: https://www.history.com/topics/black-history/martin-luther-king-jr
ENDCONTEXT
Martin Luther King Jr., an influential civil rights leader, led the Montgomery Bus Boycott in 1955, sparking a movement that eventually led to the end of segregation in America. He delivered his famous "I Have a Dream" speech at the March on Washington in 1963, inspiring millions around the world. Tragically, he was assassinated in Memphis, Tennessee, in 1968. 

ENDINPUT
BEGININSTRUCTION
What event did Martin Luther King Jr. lead in 1955 and where did he deliver his famous speech?

ENDINSTRUCTION
Martin Luther King Jr. led the Montgomery Bus Boycott in 1955 and delivered his famous "I Have a Dream" speech at the March on Washington in 1963.
